diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Renal-cell carcinoma associated with a translocation involving one of the genes in the microphthalmia-associated transcription factor family
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The large renal mass presented, along with the CT imaging features, suggested a primary renal mass rather than metastasis from a testicular source. The absence of systemic symptoms, normal laboratory findings, and the characteristics of the mass supported the suspicion of renal cancer. The rapid growth and imaging profiles indicated that a benign tumor was unlikely, leading to the conclusion that it was likely a rare variant of renal-cell carcinoma, specifically t(6;11) TFEB translocation variant.
